course.subject: ECON
course.name: The Economics of Entrepreneurship and Innovation
course.description: This course will introduce students to fundamentals of entrepreneurship and innovation, as well as the roles of entrepreneurship and innovation in the economy from an economistâ€™s perspective. The course will be separated into two parts: the first part focuses on basic concepts and tools in Entrepreneurial Finance; the second part discusses topics related to Innovation Economics. The purpose of the class is twofold: first, students are expected to acquire the basic knowledge that helps them plan and launch entrepreneurial ventures as entrepreneurs and innovators; second, students are expected to understand the economic institutions where entrepreneurship and innovation take place.
course.prerequisites: ECON 2103 OR ECON 2113

reviews.author: Orangeee
reviews.comment_content:
There are two big topics, Introduction to Entrepreneurship and Introduction to Innovation.

Part 1:
What is Entrepreneurship?
The Economic Theories of Entrepreneurship
The Determinants of Entrepreneurship
Entrepreneurial Finance
Special Topics in Entrepreneurship

Part 2:
The Nature of Innovation
Intellectual Property
Innovation and the Market
R&D Investments
Innovation Policies
Entrepreneurship & Innovation in the Asian Economies
reviews.comment_teaching:
A nice professor who explains every concept in detail and is willing to answer your questions about the coursework.  However, there is little interaction in class.

One tutorial lesson before the midterm.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very lenient.

1.  Class Participation (20%)
2.  Group Presentation (20%)
3.  Midterm Exam (30%)
4.  Term paper (30%)

It is usually a small class (10-20 students). The professor is able to recognize all students so it is not recommended to skip class. But the good point is the grading does not need to follow the school policy strictly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite low. There is only one group case study, midterm, and paper. You can find the answer for the case study online and the midterm only consists of part 1 and open-book.

For class participation, as long as you prepare for the left-over questions, you will be able to get high marks.
